title: conferred by section 67 of the Postal and Telecommunications Services Act 1983
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Postal and Telecommunications Services
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Postal and Telecommunications Services 

Act 1983 (Section 67) (Amendment) Order 2021.
text_norm: 1 order may cited postal telecommunication service act 1983 (section 67) (amendment) order 2021

title: conferred by section 67 of the Postal and Telecommunications Services Act 1983
heading: 2. The Postal and Telecommunications Services Act 1983 (Section 67)
text_raw:
2. The Postal and Telecommunications Services Act 1983 (Section 67) 

Order 2016 (S.I. No. 170 of 2016) is amended – 

(a) 

in Article 2(1), by the substitution of the following definition for 
the definition of “Payment Services Regulations”: 

“ ‘Payment Services Regulations’ means the European Union 
(Payment Services) Regulations 2018 (S.I. No. 6 of 2018);”, 

(b) 

in Article 3, by the substitution of the following paragraphs for 
paragraphs (1) and (2): 

“(1) An Post is authorised to provide services 1 to 7 and 9 
either, as it considers fit - 

(a) 

(b) 

directly, or 

indirectly through one or more An Post service 
providers or subsidiaries, 

in accordance with paragraph (2) and subject to fulfilling any 
condition that, by virtue of any other enactment or other law, is 
required to be fulfilled in respect of the provision of the service. 

(2) 

(a) Where An Post, either directly or indirectly through 
an An Post service provider or a subsidiary, provides 
services which comprise payment services, namely 
any of services 1 to 5 or 9, then Regulations 31 and 
32 of the Payment Services Regulations shall apply in 
relation to the provision of such a service as if An Post 
were a payment institution and An Post service 
providers were agents within the meaning of those 
Regulations. 

(b) Where An Post, either directly or indirectly through 
an An Post service provider or a subsidiary, provides 
services which comprise payment services, namely 
any of services 1 to 5, then Regulation 17 of the 
Payment Services Regulations shall also apply in 
relation to the provision of such a service as if An Post 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 10th September, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [460] 3 

were a payment institution and An Post service 
providers were agents within the meaning of those 
Regulations.”, 

and 

(c) 

by the substitution of the following Schedule for the Schedule to 
that Order: 

“SCHEDULE

title: conferred by section 67 of the Postal and Telecommunications Services Act 1983
heading: 1. Any service enabling cash to be placed on a payment
text_raw:
1. Any service enabling cash to be placed on a payment 
account as well as all the operations required for operating a 
payment account.
text_norm: 1 service enabling cash placed payment account well operation required operating payment account

title: conferred by section 67 of the Postal and Telecommunications Services Act 1983
heading: 2. Any service enabling cash withdrawals from a payment
text_raw:
2. Any service enabling cash withdrawals from a payment 
account as well as all the operations required for operating a 
payment account.
text_norm: 2 service enabling cash withdrawal payment account well operation required operating payment account

title: conferred by section 67 of the Postal and Telecommunications Services Act 1983
heading: 3. Execution of payment transactions, including transfers of
text_raw:
3. Execution of payment transactions, including transfers of 
funds on a payment account with the user’s payment service 
provider or with another payment service provider, that fall 
within one or more of the following subparagraphs: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

execution of direct debits, including one-off direct 
debits, 

execution of payment transactions through a payment 
card or a similar device, 

execution of credit transfers, including standing 
orders.
text_norm: 3 execution payment transaction including transfer fund payment account user payment service provider another payment service provider fall within one following subparagraphs (a) (b) (c) execution direct debit including one-off direct debit execution payment transaction payment card similar device execution credit transfer including standing order

title: conferred by section 67 of the Postal and Telecommunications Services Act 1983
heading: Issuing payment instruments or acquiring payment
text_raw:
4. 

Issuing payment instruments or acquiring payment 

transactions.

title: conferred by section 67 of the Postal and Telecommunications Services Act 1983
heading: 5. Money remittance.

title: conferred by section 67 of the Postal and Telecommunications Services Act 1983
heading: 6. Any Giro service and related money remittance, including
text_raw:
6. Any Giro service and related money remittance, including 
the issuance or encashment (or both) of Giro debit paper 
instruments.
text_norm: 6 giro service related money remittance including issuance encashment (or both) giro debit paper instrument

title: conferred by section 67 of the Postal and Telecommunications Services Act 1983
heading: 7. Any foreign exchange service, including the purchase and
text_raw:
7. Any foreign exchange service, including the purchase and 
sale of foreign currency and foreign currency instruments for the 
transmission of money. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [ 460]
text_norm: 7 foreign exchange service including purchase sale foreign currency foreign currency instrument transmission money 4 460

PASCHAL DONOHOE,
